description: Android device screen mirroring in VS Code
config.scrcpy.path: Path to scrcpy installation directory (leave empty to use PATH)
config.scrcpy.videoCodec: Video codec for screen capture. H.264 has best compatibility. H.265 offers better quality (requires device encoder support). AV1 requires hardware encoder on device (most devices lack this, causing slow/laggy video).
config.scrcpy.videoCodec.h264: H.264 (AVC) - Best compatibility, works on all browsers
config.scrcpy.videoCodec.h265: H.265 (HEVC) - Better quality/compression, limited browser support (Safari, some Chrome)
config.scrcpy.videoCodec.av1: AV1 - Best compression, but requires hardware encoder on device (rare - only newer high-end devices)
config.scrcpy.maxSize: Maximum screen dimension (width or height) in pixels
config.scrcpy.maxFps.15: 15 FPS - Low frame rate, saves bandwidth
config.scrcpy.displayMode: Display mode: mirror the main screen or create a virtual display
config.scrcpy.displayMode.mirror: Mirror - Mirror the device's main screen (default)
config.scrcpy.displayMode.virtual: Virtual - Create a separate virtual display on the device
config.scrcpy.virtualDisplayWidth: Virtual display width in pixels. *Only applies when `#scrcpy.displayMode#` is set to `virtual`.*
config.scrcpy.virtualDisplayHeight: Virtual display height in pixels. *Only applies when `#scrcpy.displayMode#` is set to `virtual`.*
config.scrcpy.virtualDisplayDpi: Virtual display DPI. Set to 0 for auto-calculation. *Only applies when `#scrcpy.displayMode#` is set to `virtual`.*
config.scrcpy.screenOff: Turn device screen off while mirroring (saves battery)
config.scrcpy.showTouches: Show visual touch feedback on device screen
config.scrcpy.lockVideoOrientation: Lock video orientation to current rotation (disables auto-rotate)
config.scrcpy.crop: Crop region to mirror. Format: `width:height:x:y` (e.g., `800:600:100:200`). Leave empty for full screen.
config.scrcpy.displayId: Display ID to mirror (0 for main display). Use the "Select Display" command to see available displays.
config.scrcpy.audio: Enable audio streaming from device (requires scrcpy 2.0+)
config.scrcpy.audioSource: Audio source to capture from device. *Only applies when `#scrcpy.audio#` is enabled.*
config.scrcpy.audioSource.output: Device playback audio (default) - captures what the device is playing
config.scrcpy.audioSource.mic: Device microphone - captures audio from the device's microphone
config.scrcpy.showStats: Show FPS and frame count statistics overlay
config.scrcpy.showExtendedStats: Show extended statistics (bitrate, dropped frames) in the stats overlay
config.scrcpy.clipboardSync: Automatically sync clipboard between host and device
config.scrcpy.screenshotSavePath: Default folder for saving screenshots. Leave empty to use the Downloads folder.
config.scrcpy.screenshotShowSaveDialog: Show save dialog instead of saving directly to the default folder
config.scrcpy.screenshotPreview: Show screenshot preview notification after capture
config.scrcpy.recordingFormat.webm: WebM - Open format, smaller files, good browser support
config.scrcpy.recordingFormat.mp4: MP4 - Universal format, best compatibility with video players
config.scrcpy.recordingSavePath: Default folder for saving recordings. Leave empty to use the Downloads folder.
config.scrcpy.recordingShowSaveDialog: Show save dialog instead of saving directly to the default folder
config.scrcpy.apkInstallDefaultPath: Default folder for the APK file picker. Leave empty to use the Downloads folder.
config.scrcpy.autoConnect: Automatically connect to devices when they are plugged in
config.scrcpy.autoReconnect: Automatically attempt to reconnect when connection is lost
config.scrcpy.reconnectRetries: Number of reconnection attempts before showing error. *Only applies when `#scrcpy.autoReconnect#` is enabled.*
config.scrcpy.cameraFacing: Which camera to use when video source is set to camera. *Only applies when `#scrcpy.videoSource#` is set to `camera`.*
config.scrcpy.cameraId: Specific camera ID to use (leave empty to auto-select). Use the "List Cameras" command to see available cameras. *Only applies when `#scrcpy.videoSource#` is set to `camera`.*
config.scrcpy.cameraSize: Camera resolution (e.g., "1920x1080"). Leave empty for automatic selection. *Only applies when `#scrcpy.videoSource#` is set to `camera`.*
config.scrcpy.cameraFps: Camera frame rate (0 for default). Common values: 15, 30, 60. *Only applies when `#scrcpy.videoSource#` is set to `camera`.*
command.connectWifi: Scrcpy: Connect to Device over WiFi
